intro: Webera lateriflora, commonly known as the lateriflorous webera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, laterally attached flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and the plant can grow up to several meters in height. Webera lateriflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
